text: [Music]
hi my name is Quintin Walz berry and I'm
a product manager here in AWS this quick
start video is an introduction to using
the refresh functionality in Amazon
quick site to keep all of your
dashboards and analysis up-to-date with
the latest data one of the biggest
advantages of quick site has over more
static file based reporting solutions is
that quick site is a hosted application
which means that your content like
dashboards and analysis are always
connected to the underlying data source
this means that instead of saving
emailing or posting new versions of a
report or dashboard every time the data
changes quick site can simply refresh
the data and everyone will instantly see
the most recent version of the
information so you can be sure that
everyone is always looking at the latest
and most up-to-date data keeping
everyone in sync across your team let's
have a look since data sets are the
foundation of all the analysis and
dashboards that you create quick cite
refreshing the data in your dashboards
and analysis is all handled at the data
set level
if quick site is directly querying your
underlying database and anytime an
analysis or dashboard that was built off
that data set is open quick site will
automatically pull the latest data from
your database and that's what will be
displayed without the need for any pre
configuration this means that your
content will always show the latest data
directly from its source for better
scaling of data you can choose to switch
to spice which is our in-memory data
store spice is a fully managed data
store that is built for ad-hoc
exploration of data and will provide
robust and fast performance you can
choose to import data into spice and
then refresh it at a frequency that
makes sense for your business to refresh
the spice data set go to the manage data
screen to see all of your data sets
click on the data set that you want to
refresh and you'll see two options
available the first is an option to
refresh nap clicking this button will
instantly begin a refresh of the data
set from the original source data once
that's complete every dashboard or
analysis that was built from it will
automatically refresh across your
account
the other option is to create a schedule
so quick site will automatically refresh
the data on an ongoing basis based on
the level of frequency you need I know
that this dataset is our sales data that
only updates once a week so I can create
a schedule to refresh the data every
Tuesday at 9:00 a.m.
once that schedule is created then quick
site will automatically refresh the data
set every Tuesday at 9:00 a.m. it will
subsequently update all the dashboards
and analyses that are connected to it
you can also create multiple schedules
for the same data set for instance if
you want this data to update twice a day
you can set one schedule to run at 9:00
a.m. and another update to run at 5:00
p.m. you can currently create refresh
schedules at the monthly weekly and
daily level we'll be adding additional
levels of granularity in upcoming
releases to learn more about using SPICE
to enhance your data and quick site be
sure to watch our quick start video on
spice on our YouTube channel thanks for
watching and I'll see you in the next
video
